meanings.definition: To grow or develop abnormally large or excessive in size
meanings.sent1: His muscles hypertrophies after consistent weightlifting.
meanings.sent2: The tumor hypertrophies rapidly, causing concern for the doctors.
meanings.sent3: The pumpkin hypertrophies so much that it wins the 'biggest vegetable' contest.
meanings.sent4: Her ego hypertrophies to the point where she can't see others' perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The tree's roots hypertrophies deep into the ground, anchoring it firmly.

meanings.definition: The act or process of growing or developing abnormally large or excessive in size
meanings.sent1: The hypertrophies of the bodybuilder's muscles were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The hypertrophies of the tumor were causing health complications.
meanings.sent3: The hypertrophies of the balloon animal made it look comically oversized.
meanings.sent4: The hypertrophies of the city's skyline symbolized rapid urbanization.
meanings.sent5: The hypertrophies of the plant's leaves made it stand out in the garden.
